Afghanistan: Abdur Rahman Khan was officially recognized as emir of Afghanistan.
Argentina: Roca became president, finally defeated federals and moved capital to Buenos Aires from Rosario
Australia: The bushranger Ned Kelly was hanged.
Parliamentarians in Victoria became the first in Australia to be paid for their work.
Chile: The United States attempts to mediate in the Lackawanna Conference, but both sides refuse to negotiate.
Colombia: Rafael Nuñez is President of the United States of Colombia
England: The Elementary Education Act 1880 was passed, making primary schooling compulsory and extending it to girls.
Germany: Kulturkampf: The First Mitigation Law was passed, resuming government payments to Prussian dioceses.
First Boer War: Boer rebels laid siege to a British fort at Potchefstroom.
Haiti: The National Bank of Haiti (or Haitian Central Bank) is founded by President Salomon
Malta: In education, "Anglicization" of Maltese students becomes a matter of policy.
Philippine: Fernando Primo de Rivera, 1st Marquis of Estella appointed Governor-General (1880–1883)(1st Term)
Manila is connected through telegraphic cable with Europe by Eastern Telecom.
Two shocks of an earthquake create destruction from Manila to Santa Cruz, Luguna. Tremors continue until Aug 6
Russia: The Special Corps of Gendarmes and the Third Section were disbanded; their functions and most capable officers were transferred to the new Department of State Police under the MVD.
USA: The University of Southern California is founded.
The Population of the United States passes 50 million.
